subject: Re: Micro-Data Tags
preview: Hi Heath,  Thanks for your email last week.  I definitely think that it would be of benefit that FB be able to pull the shop from our site into a FB catalogue so we are able to better run FB ads like

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath, Thanks for your email last week. I definitely think that it would be of benefit that FB be able to pull the shop from our site into a FB catalogue so we are able to better run FB ads like dynamic ads for abandoned card etc. We will also use Active Campaign to re-market as well - apparently they have some great WooCommerce integrations. Can you give me a break down of a few things so we have a better understanding of developer time spent currently for Renta Centre?
  • How our developer retainer is used monthly? Is it $3,000 p/month? I understand it has something to do with the security of the site?
  • What updates need to be made to the site? And how many hours do you think this will take?
  • Just confirming that our shop is through a WooCommerce plugin?
Kind Regards, Madeleine Ryan Social and Digital Marketing Manager Advantage Property Styling and Interior Design Follow us on: M 0420 301 408 | P 02 9310 1611 Tenancy 1, Unit 1, 14A Baker Street, BANKSMEADOW NSW 2019 www.advantagestyling.com.au

Hi Madeleine, 

I will have a look at this. I suspect we will need to run some extensive updates to make this work for you. The rentacentre.com.au site was build many years ago so we only update what is vital in order to keep the site as stable as possible. 

Can I confirm that your ultimate goals is to have the catalogue of the website sync up to WooCommerce and will you definitely be using this feature? I only ask is this will use up all of your included developer hours.

Hi Heath,

Phil had a go at trying to fix this issue and installed a plugin but its still not linking to FB. Is this something you can help with?

Kind Regards,

Madeleine Ryan
Social and Digital Marketing Manager
Advantage Property Styling and Interior Design

On 11 Aug 2020, at 9:25 am, Madeleine Ryan <madeleine@advantagestyling.com.au <mailto:madeleine@advantagestyling.com.au>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Hope you’re good this morning.

So apparently the pixel was deleted unfortunately and all that data has been lost – Phil has deleted those old pixels now off the website and has installed the new pixel code on the website – 3276841095764501 Can you please double check that has been done for all pages?

The next step to getting our Catalogues active is to put in place Micro tags apparently – have you done this before for ecommerce sites? I haven’t had experience with this.

Here are the FB instructions: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/catalog/guides/microdata-tags <https://aus01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdevelopers.facebook.com%2Fdocs%2Fmarketing-api%2Fcatalog%2Fguides%2Fmicrodata-tags&data=02%7C01%7Cmadeleine%40advantagestyling.com.au%7C9b26a2beafef4adf9c9008d83d861b6d%7C990eae31a9404d14b2ac18d698fa2459%7C1%7C0%7C637326993489015193&sdata=riQyNTqFAZGN9z5QurGHIwoJe64zCdNO9%2B8k5ZWuTuc%3D&reserved=0>

Would you be able to do this for all products?

Kind Regards,

Madeleine Ryan
Social and Digital Marketing Manager
Advantage Property Styling and Interior Design
